These are the relevant parts that he was referencing. Your account is essentially a lease agreement between you and Riot, you do not own the account or anything on it, in the same way you do not own a house you pay rent for.

Do I must go through the T+C's and prove to you what the above poster is trying to say? Yes, I think I must.

http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse
And
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse

If you compare them together, https://www.changedetection.com/comparepages.html, you will notice they are different in some aspects.

Namely on the OCE page it has:
_ (1)    By Riot Games.  TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, RIOT GAMES RESERVES THE RIGHT TO SUSPEND, TERMINATE, MODIFY OR DELETE YOUR ACCOUNT AT ANY TIME FOR ANY REASON OR NO REASON, AND, UNLESS OTHERWISE REQUIRED BY LAW, WITH NO LIABILITY OF ANY KIND TO YOU._

That above paragraph is NOT on the NA page. _TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW._

I'll say it again: TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW.

Can you understand a bit better now?

Continuing on this path, NA has this:
_Any reproduction, redistribution, or modification of the Properties, or use of the Properties not in accordance with the EULA or this Agreement, is expressly prohibited by law and may result in severe civil and criminal penalties._

OCE has this:
_Any reproduction, redistribution, or modification of the Properties, or use of the Properties not in accordance with the EULA or this Agreement, is expressly prohibited and may result in severe civil and criminal penalties under applicable legislation._

NA:
_NO REFUNDS WILL BE MADE FOR THE PURCHASE OF RIOT POINTS OR FOR VIRTUAL ITEMS OBTAINED USING RIOT POINTS._

OCE:
_NO REFUNDS WILL BE MADE FOR VIRTUAL ITEMS OBTAINED USING RIOT POINTS._

I can go on, but there are very obvious changes in the T+C's on the OCE page as compared to the NA page, and it may be different on ALL the countries own pages, simply put, the ACCC has consumer protection laws that assist us here in Australia much more so than some countries, and therefore everyone on the OCE servers get the same protection, or more so, the better protection that each country listed as being 'OCE'.

You see, if they play the entire SE Asia and everything in between down to Australia and NZ into the 'OCE' category, the laws will be ridiculous, so they state OCE as being only like 4 countries so they can limit the T+C page and not shoot themselves too much in the foot.

On OCE, NOT on NA:
_you acknowledge that the Content is accessible to third parties_

On NA, NOT on OCE:
_Riot Games has the right but not the obligation, in its sole discretion, to edit, refuse to post,_

NA:
_Riot Games does not assume any responsibility or liability for Content that is generated by users of the Site and/or Game. Riot Games has the right but not the obligation, in its sole discretion, to edit, refuse to post, or remove any Content._

OCE:
_You acknowledge and agree that you have no expectation of privacy concerning the submission of any Content you acknowledge that the Content is accessible to third parties, and you further acknowledge and agree that your Chat may be used as part of The Tribunal proceedings as more specifically set forth in Section VI._

Shit man, we can post ANYTHING WE FUCKING LIKE and Riot has no right to refuse to post it on the OCE site.

This part, _XV. NEGOTIATIONS, BINDING ARBITRATION AND GOVERNING LAW_, is about 90% different on both sites. There is really a lot different, but mainly the laws around the ACL from the ACCC DO in fact affect how the T+C's are on the OCE site, why? Because here in Australia we have consumer rights.

EDIT: If you do not believe us, go check out section _**XV. (H)**_, they go on about rights under the ACL for Australian users on the OCE T+C's.

In this case though the difference doesn't matter. Because Riot owns the account it is still well within the limits of the law for them to terminate an account for a valid reason. Yes the NA and OCE ones are slightly different, and yes I should have taken from the OCE page, but the pieces I pulled are identical in both, and is all that's really applicable here. Again, like a house, the landowner is well within their rights to kick you out within "THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW". Just as Riot is well within their rights to 'kick you out' of your account.

And what is the applicable law here? Those in the ACL set out by the ACCC.

In Australia the ACCC protects you, even on LoL as it is just another Good or Service and therefore unless you break the Australian Laws, hacking, cheating, defrauding, or whatever else you can do on LoL that is against the law, you cannot lose your account.

Again that would only be true if you owned the account. A landowner can kick you out for being too rowdy, but you can't be kicked out of your own house for the same (though you can be fined). The same applies here. I find myself using the same analogy but it really does fit quite well. 

You do not own the house (your account) here, you are subject to any rules/conditions the landowner (Riot) deems fit within the limits of the law, and kicking you out (banning you) is well within the limits of the law.

Permanently banning someone is well within "the maximum extent permitted by the applicable law". You do not own your account, it is a lease.

A lease is a contractual arrangement calling for the lessee (user) to pay the lessor (owner) for use of an asset.

It is not even a lease, a rent, or anything else you want to call it. Unlike WoW and other similar games, you do not pay for a LoL account in anyway whatsoever. The stuff you buy from the store, as stated in the T+C's, cannot be refunded. But on the OCE site, it says nothing about the RP not being able to be refunded unlike NA.

You don't actually need to pay to play the game, you don't need to pay to win, you don't need to offer any money and therefore your account technically has a zero monetary value. What Riot is offering is a SERVICE, not a good to the public, therefore, technically, no one owns the account since no one is paying for it or has paid for it.

The account is free to make and free to use, making it technically, no ones asset. Therefore, Riot, under the ACL set out by the ACCC, cannot remove your account unless you break the law.

Once I read through the T+C's, it made me realise, Riot cannot ban you from the OCE server, and I cannot see if they have ANY reason to do so unless you are breaking any law that is applicable in your country, like criminal laws and so on, but that is kind of hard to do.

In short, if you are a dickhead and act like one, Riot can't stop you. They can try to slow you down, but they cannot stop it from happening.

Basically, they can only ban you if you break the law, not the T+C's, the actual law from the country you are in that is classified as being a part of OCE.
